intro: Cathartolinum agreste, commonly known as the wild cathartol, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its erect stems and showy violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for digestive ailments.
